question: What is the mechanism of action of Teclistamab?
ideal_answer: Teclistamab is a bispecific antibody that targets CD3 and B cell maturation antigen (BCMA) and is being developed for the treatment of relapsed or refractory multiple myeloma.

snippets.text: BACKGROUND: Teclistamab is a T-cell-redirecting bispecific antibody that targets both CD3 expressed on the surface of T cells and B-cell maturation antigen expressed on the surface of myeloma cells.
BACKGROUND: Teclistamab (JNJ-64007957), a B-cell maturation antigen × CD3 bispecific antibody, displayed potent T-cell-mediated cytotoxicity of multiple myeloma cells in preclinical studies.
The bispecific antibodies teclistamab (BCMA×CD3) and talquetamab (G protein-coupled receptor family C group 5 member D [GPRC5D]×CD3) are in clinical development as therapies for MM.

Teclistamab (TECVAYLI®), a bispecific antibody that targets CD3 and B cell maturation antigen (BCMA), is being developed by Janssen Research and Development for the treatment of relapsed or refractory multiple myeloma.
